com.oracle.tools.runtime.java
Interface JavaApplicationSchema<A extends JavaApplication<A>,S extends JavaApplicationSchema<A,S>>

All Superinterfaces:
ApplicationSchema<A,S>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractJavaApplicationSchema, SimpleJavaApplicationSchema
public interface JavaApplicationSchema<A extends JavaApplication<A>,S extends JavaApplicationSchema<A,S>>
extends ApplicationSchema<A,S>

A JavaApplicationSchema is a Java specific ApplicationSchema.

Author:
Brian Oliver

          Obtains the name of the method to start JavaApplications built using this JavaApplicationSchema, when running ExecutionMode#InternalProcess mode.

          Obtains the PropertiesBuilder that will be used as a basis for configuring the Java System Properties of the realized JavaApplications from an JavaApplicationBuilder.

createJavaApplication

A createJavaApplication(Process process,
                        String name,
                        ApplicationConsole console,
                        Properties environmentVariables,
                        Properties systemProperties)
Instantiates a JavaApplication to represent the specified Java Process and properties. It's through this JavaApplication that developers will interact with the underlying Java Process.

Parameters:
process - the Process representing the JavaApplication
name - the name of the JavaApplication
console - the ApplicationConsole that will be used for I/O by the realized Application. This may be null if not required
environmentVariables - the environment variables used when starting the JavaApplication
systemProperties - the system properties provided to the JavaApplication
Returns:
a JavaApplication
